title: AudiType
content:
Audi has switched to a custom type.

[http://fontfeed.com/archives/typographic-relaunch-for-audi](http://web.archive.org/web/20090326045936/http:/fontfeed.com/archives/typographic-relaunch-for-audi "http://fontfeed.com/archives/typographic-relaunch-for-audi")

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20090326045936im_/http:/typophile.com/files/audi_5259.jpg)

 [‹ Broadcast/License Fonts Rules/Regulations/Laws?](http://web.archive.org/web/20090326045936/http:/typophile.com/node/56076 "Go to previous forum topic") [Wisconsin's new logo & slogan controversy ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20090326045936/http:/typophile.com/node/55981 "Go to next forum topic")
author: epsilicon

comments.content: Further proof that the only real way to get a type that conveys luxury is to commission something exclusive.
Proof that Verdana is a timeless classic :-)
